hints_raw: This is a Bernoulli process. What is your random variable? What is ''n'', what is ''p''?
question: 1 (b)
sols_html:
This is a Bernoulli process with probability of success p = 1/4, and n = 2 repetitions.

Let X be the random variable that counts the number of successful casts. Then

\[\begin{aligned} \text{Prob(at least 1 success)} &= \text{Prob}(X \geq 1) \\ &= \text{Prob}(X = 1 \text{ or } X = 2) \\ &= \text{Prob}(X = 1) + \text{Prob}(X = 2) \\ &= C(2,1)\left(\frac14\right)^1 \left(1-\frac14\right)^{2-1} \\ &\text{ }+ C(2,2)\left(\frac14\right)^2 \left(1-\frac14\right)^{2-2} \\ &= \frac7{16}.\end{aligned}\]

Hence, answer (b) is correct.

We can also use a tree diagram to solve this. Recall that we multiply along branches, and then sum the results.

statement_html:
Multiple Choice question: Select ONE correct answer. You will not be graded for any work.

You are out fishing. Every time you cast your line, the probability that you catch a fish is 1/4. What is the probability that you catch at least one fish within the first 2 attempts?

(a) 1/16

(b) 7/16

(c) 1/2

(d) 9/16

(e) 15/16
